title: SuperCookie or PUP ----possibly malicious.
content:
Hello ,

This is my first time to ask for help or have a question. I have a program that finds Super-Cookies that are not

deleted by normal means. HSTS is another word for them. This one is owner@realserv.com which can redirect your browser and is mainly to spread adds: It can also read info on your computer;however I am having no problems from it that I know of and have discussed it with others that say it is not malicious and is in fact a Microsoft file. In any case I have found a site to offers a way to remove it.

https://sensorstechforum.com/realsrv-virus/#what-is-realsrv-

I only use Firefox but in following the directions given I was unable to remove it. The page was probably written before all the changes to Firefox.

Can you advise on this subject? Firefox is latest version.

Thanks Paul
creator: kendall20202020

title: Firefox 110.0.1 can not work well with MS Office 365 online while typing with iBus IME
content:
Hi there: I can not type Chinese and Japanese in recently updated Firefox. It is work well some versions before.

MS Office 365 Excel is OK. MS Office 365 Word is not OK. I only can type English but no any CJK characters after feeding newline. MS Office 365 PowerPoint is broken too.

It is work well with Google Chrome browser on Linux.

My system: OS: Debian GNU/Linux bookworm/sid Firefox: Mozilla Firefox 110.0.1 (From https://www.mozilla.org/zh-TW/firefox/download/thanks/) IME: iBus 1.5.27
creator: zero00072

title: Site Log In
content: I have a subscription to the following site https://plus.globalcyclingnetwork.com/login, since I have been using the updated browser, I can no longer log in & I receive the following error 'There was an error logging in'. I first sort support from GCN directly, however all of their suggestions have not rectified the error. I have tested my credentials on a third party laptop and have no problems logging in to GCN+ site. At times I also receive the error in the attached document. I have tried turning off the Enhanced Tracking, but that didn't work either.
creator: masana136

title: Can't Locate History
content: Please help, I'm trying to see what actual DATE I went to the website, and/or the time. All Firefox history shows me is the order in which I went to the website. For example, if I got to History>Today> it just says that I went to supportdotmozilladotorg, not the date or time. Same if I go to "Last 7 days" - it's simply a list of the sites I've visited, not which day of the week I went to them. Any advice would be appreciated as this is somewhat urgent since I'm trying to report fraud from a website and need to show what date/time my activity was on there. Please help and thank you. I've attached a picture for reference.
creator: sagustam

title: Lost bookmarks, search changed to Google,
content:
Just opened Firefox to discover what appeared to be an unauthorized update: all bookmarks gone, no menu bars, search change to Google, screen littered with links to twitter and similar organizations. "About" says this is 110.0.1, same as another computer which appears as usual.

Any suggestions?
creator: john_hazell

title: Mozilla browser not working anymore for my online banking
content: Not exactly sure why but the browser is no longer working for my banking. I first noticed it a week ago when I tried to log in and then ended up calling the bank tech support. They told me to use google chrome instead. I have been using Firefox for years and never had a problem. After researching for latest update changes, I tried changing the settings to allow cookies for the session for the bank but this did not work either. Any idea why this is happening? Thank you. Tony.
creator: tony.koukounas

title: Issue with trying to Access Ticketmaster.Com.  Is it their site or my settings?
content: I have attached a screen shot of what I am getting when I try to access TicketMaster.Com. What have or am I doing wrong? Where or How Can I Fix This?
creator: dhjohnson1961

title: Firefox passwords missing (profile intact, weird startup page)
content:
After restarting my computer all of my passwords have disappeared. I still have all my bookmarks, history and download history, extensions (though they are not visible on the upper tab like usual) even some user prompts. The start up page is two tabs "Open up an amazing internet Our latest version is built around you,.." says on, while the second is " Firefox Privacy Notice Effective August 1, 2022 ". These two tabs keep opening on startup even though Ive restarted dozens of times and chose specific statup pages in settings.

What happened to my passwords and what ways can I attempt to recover them. Was I synced with a Firefox account and theyre missing because I logged out (why are bookmarks still visible then)? (I tried typing in various email addresses I own into Sync but it gave me a signup prompt so I assume that means there is no account attached to these emails?).
creator: ivad918

title: How to change New Private Window keyboard shortcut?
content:
I am new to Firefox, and have just discovered that in order to open a new private window I must use the Ctrl + Shift + P keyboard shortcut which is pretty much impossible to accomplish with one hand. I tried to use this extension:

https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/shortkeys/

But sadly my new added shortcuts were not opening the new private window while the ctrl + shift + p still worked, and it appears that this extension is only able to add new shortcuts and not change nor delete the existing ones. I want to assign a comfortable keyboard shortcut for opening a we private window (optionally unassign the Ctrl + Shift + N from Undo close window and assign that keyboard to open a new private window).
creator: Shmark
